EJHSS Edavanna

Edavanna, Malappuram Dt., Kerala

Date: 31 July 2025

 

To

The Director

Jamia Nadwiyya Edavanna

 

Subject: Request for Sanction of Fund and Auditorium Booking for Freshers’ Day 2025

 

Respected Sir,

 

Warm greetings.

 

We are planning to organize a memorable Freshers’ Day program for the newly admitted students of EJHSS Edavanna on 12th August 2025. The event is intended to welcome our freshers warmly, introduce them to the academic and cultural environment of the school, and foster a spirit of belonging and motivation.

 

In connection with this, we kindly request:

1. Permission to conduct the program in the Central Auditorium on 12.08.2025.

2. A financial sanction of 27,000/- to meet the expenses related to stage arrangements, refreshments, mementos, and technical support.

 

We assure you that the program will be conducted in a disciplined, creative, and value-oriented manner. Your support in making this event a success will be deeply appreciated.

 

Kindly consider this request and grant the necessary approvals at your earliest convenience.

 

Thanking you.

 

Yours faithfully,

Abdul Gafoor Swalahi

Principal

EJHSS Edavanna

To 

The Director

Jamia Nadwiyya

Edavanna

 

Subject: Request for Sanction of Hostel Caution Deposit Refund – Ahammed Zayan Abdul Samad

 

Respected Sir,

 

I am forwarding herewith an application from Ahammed Zayan Abdul Samad, a student who has transferred from our institution to another school. He has requested the refund of his Hostel Caution Deposit paid at the time of admission.

 

As per our records, the Hostel Caution Deposit of Rs. 6,500/- is refundable.

 

I kindly request your approval to sanction the refund amount of Rs. 6,500/- to the student at the earliest.

 

Thanking you for your kind consideration.

 

With warm regards,

 

 

 

 

ABDUL GAFOOR V

Principal

Edavanna Jamia Higher Secondary School

To,                                                                                     
The Director
Jamia Nadwiyya
Edavanna

30-07-2025

Subject: Reminder and Request for Urgent Action – Computer Lab Requirement and Office System Replacement

Respected Sir,

With due respect, we would like to bring to your kind attention that despite our repeated requests regarding the urgent need for computers in the school lab, we have not yet received any reply or action.

We had earlier submitted the following letters for this purpose:

1.      Letter dated 06-05-2025 – Request for immediate allocation of 10 computers for the school lab and 1 system for library automation.

2.      Letter dated 10-06-2025 – Request for restoration of computer lab and additional systems for office and library.

3.      Letter dated 11-03-2025 – Request for facilities and maintenance works, including 10 computers for the computer lab.

 

Unfortunately, as of today, the Computerized Accounting Lab for +2 commerce students could not be conducted because the lab remains non-functional due to the lack of computers. This is already affecting the timely completion of the curriculum and may adversely impact the academic progress of the students.

Additionally, we would like to highlight that the office computer system is an old 2010 model (over 15 years old) and does not work smoothly. Frequent hanging and performance issues are disrupting our administrative work. We urgently need one new desktop computer for office tasks, especially to run Tally Prime upgrades and other essential applications efficiently.

We therefore request your urgent intervention and approval to:

·         Allocate and install the required 10 computers for the school computer lab immediately.

·         Sanction and provide one new desktop computer for the school office.

 

We trust you will treat this matter as highly urgent in the interest of smooth academic and administrative functioning.

Thank you for your understanding and prompt action.

Yoursfaithfully,
Principal
Edavanna Jamia HSS

To                                                                                        The Director,

Jamia Nadwiyya, Edavanna

 

Subject: Request for Refund of Admission Booking Fee – Ain Fathima

 

Respected Sir,

 

This is to bring to your kind attention that the parent of Ain Fathima, who had initially booked admission in the Science Academy by paying Rs. 5000 during the admission booking period, has submitted a formal request for a refund.

 

Since the student has now secured admission in another school under a scholarship program, she did not proceed with joining our institution. Considering the genuine nature of the request, I kindly request your approval to process the refund of Rs. 5000 to the parent.

 

The parent’s request letter is enclosed herewith for your reference.

 

Thanking you,

 

Yours faithfully,

Principal

EJHSS

To,                                                                                         The Director

Jamia Nadwiyya

Edavanna

 

01-08-2025

 

Subject: Request for Sanction of Faculty Fee for July 2025 – Jamia Nadwiyya Science Academy

 

 

Respected Sir,

 

 

I am writing to kindly request the sanction of the faculty fee for the month of July 2025 for Jamia Nadwiyya Science Academy, as per the terms of our agreement. The total amount to be sanctioned is Rs. 1,80,000/ (Rupees One Lakh Eighty Thousand Only).

 

We request you to kindly approve and release the said amount at the earliest convenience to ensure the smooth functioning of academic activities and timely remuneration of the faculty members.

 

Thank you for your continued support and cooperation.

 

 

Yours sincerely,

Abdul Gafoor V

Principal

Edavanna Jamia Higher Secondary School

To

   The Director

Sir

   I bring to your kind notice that Ms. HUSNA T P (Assistant Professor in Mathematics) who part time work (2 days / week) in second semester FYUGP 2024-25 academic year, now has only a workload of 8 hours a week in III semester FYUGP 2025-26 academic year. She has to work for 3 days to complete the portions.

So far, we had been paying Rs.8000/- (eight thousand ) for two days  part time work (maximum 6 hrs.) Since she has to works for 3 days, I request you to kindly put a hike in her part time salary.

Principal

Jamia Nadwiyya Arts and Science College

To

   The Director

Sir

The Department of Commerce & Management Studies at Jamia Nadwiyya Arts & Science College has requested permission for the third-year B.Com and BBA students to visit the Salva Care Home in Pandikkad, and for the school bus to be granted for transporting the students.

A total of 45 students from the B.Com and BBA classes, along with 4 faculty members, intend to depart from the college on Saturday, August2,2025, at 9:30AM, and return to the college by 4:00PM on the same day.

We respectfully request permission for the visit of all 45 students to Salva Care Home in Pandikkad and kindly ask that our school bus be granted for this purpose.

 

Principal

jamia Nadwiyya Arts and Science College

To,                                                                                            The Director,

Jamia Nadwiyya

Date: 01-08-2025

Subject: Request for Approval of Payment to English Teacher Mr. Rasheed Binsy for July 2025

 Respected Sir,

I am writing to request approval for the payment of Mr. Rasheed Binsy, who has been conducting English classes at JNSA School.

 

 

For the month of July 2025, Mr. Rasheed Bincy has conducted a total of 16.75 hours of classes. At the agreed rate of .600 per hour, his total payment amounts to .10,050/-

 

11-07-2025 - 5 Hr 30 Min

18-07-2025 - 5 Hr 30 Min

25-07-2025 - 5 Hr 45 Min

 

I kindly request your approval for this payment and ask that the necessary arrangements be made for disbursement at your earliest convenience.

 

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

 

Sincerely,

V Abdul Gafoor

Principal,

EJHSS

To

   The Director

Sir

The Jamia Nadwiyya Arts and Science College has admitted 4 students to the first semester of the M.Com program for the academic year 2025–26. Since there are 25 class periods per week, the Head of the Department has submitted a letter requesting the appointment of an additional teacher for the Commerce Department. Therefore, we kindly request the appointment of one more teacher to the Commerce Department.

 

Principal

 Jamia Nadwiyya Arts and Science College

JNE Central Library

01/08/2025

To

The Director

Jamia Nadwiyya Group of Institutions

Subject: Request for Sanction of Newspaper and Magazine Subscription  

               Charges (August 2024 - March 2025)

Respected Sir,

This letter is to request the sanction of funds for the subscription charges of newspapers and career magazines for the period from August 2024 to March 2025.

Subject: Request to Expand Library Subscriptions for the Upcoming Academic Year

Respected Sir, Assalamu Alaikkum.

Our library currently subscribes to a number of newspapers and career magazines that cater to the general student population. However, to enhance our resources and cater to the diverse interests of our students, I would like to propose an expansion of our subscription list for the upcoming academic year.

I believe adding more specialized publications would be highly beneficial. Specifically, I recommend the following:

1. Career Journals: We should subscribe to additional career-oriented journals to provide more comprehensive information and opportunities for our students.

2. General Interest Magazines: To foster a love for reading and provide a balance to academic material, I propose subscribing to magazines that are popular among our students. This includes:

  • Magazines for female students: Adding magazines like Vanitha and Kudumbam would cater to the interests of our female students.

  • Popular general magazines: Subscribing to magazines like Frontline and a couple of other popular Malayalam magazines would provide in-depth analysis on current affairs and a wide range of topics.

3. Arabic Journals: Given the nature of our institution, it would be a significant addition to our collection to include Arabic journals if they are available. This would be a valuable resource for students and faculty specializing in Arabic language and Islamic studies.

Expanding our subscriptions in these areas will enrich the learning environment and ensure that our library remains a relevant and dynamic resource for all members of the Jamia Nadwiyya community. I have given here a tentative list of publications along with their estimated annual subscription costs for your consideration.

  1. Employment News   Rs. 530/yr.
  2. Vanitha Magazine     Rs. 650/yr.
  3. Mathrubhumi Arogyamasika Rs. 360/yr.
  4. The Week                  Rs. 1299

I kindly request your permission to proceed with these new subscriptions.

Thank you for your time and consideration.

Sincerely,

Chief Librarian

Jamia Nadwiyya Group of Institutions

Subject: Request to Expand Library Subscriptions for the Upcoming Academic Year

Respected Sir, Assalamu Alaikkum.

Our library currently subscribes to a number of newspapers and career magazines that cater to the general student population. However, to enhance our resources and cater to the diverse interests of our students, I would like to propose an expansion of our subscription list for the upcoming academic year.

I believe adding more specialized publications would be highly beneficial. Specifically, I recommend the following:

1. Career Journals: We should subscribe to additional career-oriented journals to provide more comprehensive information and opportunities for our students.

2. General Interest Magazines: To foster a love for reading and provide a balance to academic material, I propose subscribing to magazines that are popular among our students. This includes:

  • Magazines for female students: Adding magazines like Vanitha and Kudumbam would cater to the interests of our female students.

  • Popular general magazines: Subscribing to magazines like Frontline and a couple of other popular Malayalam magazines would provide in-depth analysis on current affairs and a wide range of topics.

3. Arabic Journals: Given the nature of our institution, it would be a significant addition to our collection to include Arabic journals if they are available. This would be a valuable resource for students and faculty specializing in Arabic language and Islamic studies.

Expanding our subscriptions in these areas will enrich the learning environment and ensure that our library remains a relevant and dynamic resource for all members of the Jamia Nadwiyya community. I have given here a tentative list of publications along with their estimated annual subscription costs for your consideration.

  1. Employment News   Rs. 530/yr.
  2. Vanitha Magazine     Rs. 650/yr.
  3. Mathrubhumi Arogyamasika Rs. 360/yr.
  4. The Week                  Rs. 1299

I kindly request your permission to proceed with these new subscriptions.

Thank you for your time and consideration.

Sincerely,

Chief Librarian

Jamia Nadwiyya Group of Institutions

JNE Central Library

Subject: Reminder and Request for Urgent Action – Computer Lab Requirement and Office System Replacement

Respected Sir,

With due respect, we would like to bring to your kind attention that despite our repeated requests regarding the urgent need for computers in the school lab, we have not yet received any reply or action.

We had earlier submitted the following letters for this purpose:

1.      Letter dated 06-05-2025 – Request for immediate allocation of 10 computers for the school lab and 1 system for library automation.

2.      Letter dated 10-06-2025 – Request for restoration of computer lab and additional systems for office and library.

3.      Letter dated 11-03-2025 – Request for facilities and maintenance works, including 10 computers for the computer lab.

 

Unfortunately, as of today, the Computerized Accounting Lab for +2 commerce students could not be conducted because the lab remains non-functional due to the lack of computers. This is already affecting the timely completion of the curriculum and may adversely impact the academic progress of the students.

Additionally, we would like to highlight that the office computer system is an old 2010 model (over 15 years old) and does not work smoothly. Frequent hanging and performance issues are disrupting our administrative work. We urgently need one new desktop computer for office tasks, especially to run Tally Prime upgrades and other essential applications efficiently.

We therefore request your urgent intervention and approval to:

·         Allocate and install the required 10 computers for the school computer lab immediately.

·         Sanction and provide one new desktop computer for the school office.

 

We trust you will treat this matter as highly urgent in the interest of smooth academic and administrative functioning.

Thank you for your understanding and prompt action.

Yoursfaithfully,
Principal
Edavanna Jamia HSS

Subject: Request to Expand Library Subscriptions for the Upcoming Academic Year

Respected Sir, Assalamu Alaikkum.

Our library currently subscribes to a number of newspapers and career magazines that cater to the general student population. However, to enhance our resources and cater to the diverse interests of our students, I would like to propose an expansion of our subscription list for the upcoming academic year.

I believe adding more specialized publications would be highly beneficial. Specifically, I recommend the following:

1. Career Journals: We should subscribe to additional career-oriented journals to provide more comprehensive information and opportunities for our students.

2. General Interest Magazines: To foster a love for reading and provide a balance to academic material, I propose subscribing to magazines that are popular among our students. This includes:

  • Magazines for female students: Adding magazines like Vanitha and Kudumbam would cater to the interests of our female students.

  • Popular general magazines: Subscribing to magazines like Frontline and a couple of other popular Malayalam magazines would provide in-depth analysis on current affairs and a wide range of topics.

3. Arabic Journals: Given the nature of our institution, it would be a significant addition to our collection to include Arabic journals if they are available. This would be a valuable resource for students and faculty specializing in Arabic language and Islamic studies.

Expanding our subscriptions in these areas will enrich the learning environment and ensure that our library remains a relevant and dynamic resource for all members of the Jamia Nadwiyya community. I have given here a tentative list of publications along with their estimated annual subscription costs for your consideration.

  1. Employment News   Rs. 530/yr.
  2. Vanitha Magazine     Rs. 650/yr.
  3. Mathrubhumi Arogyamasika Rs. 360/yr.
  4. The Week                  Rs. 1299

I kindly request your permission to proceed with these new subscriptions.

Thank you for your time and consideration.

Sincerely,

Chief Librarian

Jamia Nadwiyya Group of Institutions

Subject: Reminder and Request for Urgent Action – Computer Lab Requirement and Office System Replacement

Respected Sir,

With due respect, we would like to bring to your kind attention that despite our repeated requests regarding the urgent need for computers in the school lab, we have not yet received any reply or action.

We had earlier submitted the following letters for this purpose:

1.      Letter dated 06-05-2025 – Request for immediate allocation of 10 computers for the school lab and 1 system for library automation.

2.      Letter dated 10-06-2025 – Request for restoration of computer lab and additional systems for office and library.

3.      Letter dated 11-03-2025 – Request for facilities and maintenance works, including 10 computers for the computer lab.

 

Unfortunately, as of today, the Computerized Accounting Lab for +2 commerce students could not be conducted because the lab remains non-functional due to the lack of computers. This is already affecting the timely completion of the curriculum and may adversely impact the academic progress of the students.

Additionally, we would like to highlight that the office computer system is an old 2010 model (over 15 years old) and does not work smoothly. Frequent hanging and performance issues are disrupting our administrative work. We urgently need one new desktop computer for office tasks, especially to run Tally Prime upgrades and other essential applications efficiently.

We therefore request your urgent intervention and approval to:

·         Allocate and install the required 10 computers for the school computer lab immediately.

·         Sanction and provide one new desktop computer for the school office.

 

We trust you will treat this matter as highly urgent in the interest of smooth academic and administrative functioning.

Thank you for your understanding and prompt action.

Yoursfaithfully,
Principal
Edavanna Jamia HSS

Subject: Request to Expand Library Subscriptions for the Upcoming Academic Year

Respected Sir, Assalamu Alaikkum.

Our library currently subscribes to a number of newspapers and career magazines that cater to the general student population. However, to enhance our resources and cater to the diverse interests of our students, I would like to propose an expansion of our subscription list for the upcoming academic year.

I believe adding more specialized publications would be highly beneficial. Specifically, I recommend the following:

1. Career Journals: We should subscribe to additional career-oriented journals to provide more comprehensive information and opportunities for our students.

2. General Interest Magazines: To foster a love for reading and provide a balance to academic material, I propose subscribing to magazines that are popular among our students. This includes:

  • Magazines for female students: Adding magazines like Vanitha and Kudumbam would cater to the interests of our female students.

  • Popular general magazines: Subscribing to magazines like Frontline and a couple of other popular Malayalam magazines would provide in-depth analysis on current affairs and a wide range of topics.

3. Arabic Journals: Given the nature of our institution, it would be a significant addition to our collection to include Arabic journals if they are available. This would be a valuable resource for students and faculty specializing in Arabic language and Islamic studies.

Expanding our subscriptions in these areas will enrich the learning environment and ensure that our library remains a relevant and dynamic resource for all members of the Jamia Nadwiyya community. I have given here a tentative list of publications along with their estimated annual subscription costs for your consideration.

  1. Employment News   Rs. 530/yr.
  2. Vanitha Magazine     Rs. 650/yr.
  3. Mathrubhumi Arogyamasika Rs. 360/yr.
  4. The Week                  Rs. 1299

I kindly request your permission to proceed with these new subscriptions.

Thank you for your time and consideration.

Sincerely,

Chief Librarian

Jamia Nadwiyya Group of Institutions

With sincere regards,
Dr.Vaseel K

fields.description:
Subject: Request for Leave to Attend Final Semester B.Ed Examination

Sir,

  I am writing to kindly request permission to be relieved from my official duties during the period from 18th August 2025 to 29th August 2025, as I will be attending my Final Semester B.Ed Examinations during these dates.

As these examinations are crucial for the successful completion of my professional qualification, I wish to dedicate this time fully to preparation and performance. I assure you that all academic responsibilities currently under my charge will be duly handed over or managed as per your instructions prior to the leave period.

I respectfully request your kind consideration and approval for the same.

Thank you for your understanding and support.

Yours sincerely,
MOHAMMED SAHIR K
VICE PRINCIPAL,
JNRHS Edavanna

To

  The Director

  Jamia Nadwiyya 

Subject: Request for Permission to Conduct the Inauguration of the Computer Application Department Association

Attached herewith is a letter requesting permission to conduct the inauguration of the Computer Application Department Association for the academic year 2025-26 at Jamia Nadwiyya Arts and Science College.

The program is scheduled to be held on Wednesday, August 13, 2025, at 10:00 AM.

Dr. Fasil O.K (PH. D, Project Lead at Samsung Electro- Mechanics  and renowned expert in the field of LLMOps, AI, Machine Learning and Brain Signal Analysis)   is proposed to be invited as the Chief Guest for the association inauguration.

An approximate expense of Rs. 5,000/-, including the TA for the guest, is expected for conducting the program. It has been requested that this amount be sanctioned from the college fund.

Therefore, we kindly request permission to conduct the 2025-26 Computer Application Department Association inauguration and to sanction the required funds from the college.

Subject: Sanction for Purchase of Robotic Kits for Grade 10 Students – JNRHS

Ref: Request from Dr. Vaseel K, Principal, JNRHS dated 06.08.2025

As per the recent academic directive from the Government of Kerala and SCERT regarding the mandatory inclusion of Robotics in the Grade 10 curriculum, approval is hereby granted for the purchase of 10 robotic kits (767 per kit, total 7,670) to ensure effective implementation of hands-on learning and STEM project activities.

The procurement shall be made from vendors listed in the approved SCERT list. The Principal is requested to initiate the purchase process at the earliest to align with the state curriculum timeline.

If there is any feasible possibility to collect this amount (767 per student) from the concerned students or parents without burdening them, it may be encouraged. However, the implementation of the curriculum shall not be delayed due to fund collection.

This order is issued in the interest of enriching the academic standards and fulfilling SCERT curriculum mandates at JNRHS.

Copy to:

  • Principal, JNRHS

  • Accounts Section

  • File

Subject: Sanction for Purchase of Robotic Kits for Grade 10 Students – JNRHS

Ref: Request from Dr. Vaseel K, Principal, JNRHS dated 06.08.2025

As per the recent academic directive from the Government of Kerala and SCERT regarding the mandatory inclusion of Robotics in the Grade 10 curriculum, approval is hereby granted for the purchase of 10 robotic kits (767 per kit, total 7,670) to ensure effective implementation of hands-on learning and STEM project activities.

The procurement shall be made from vendors listed in the approved SCERT list. The Principal is requested to initiate the purchase process at the earliest to align with the state curriculum timeline.

If there is any feasible possibility to collect this amount (767 per student) from the concerned students or parents without burdening them, it may be encouraged. However, the implementation of the curriculum shall not be delayed due to fund collection.

This order is issued in the interest of enriching the academic standards and fulfilling SCERT curriculum mandates at JNRHS.
